title: Basic Usage
text: provide scale_fill_jonohey() scale_color_jonohey() able integrate package ggplot2. ’s example  principle, one use palettes continuous mapping . advised , nobody really stopping right now.
code: # discrete library(ggplot2) ggplot(mtcars, aes(factor(cyl), mpg, fill = factor(cyl))) +   geom_boxplot() +   scale_fill_jonohey("suit") # continuous example # DEMO ONLY # Probably not the best color choice!!!! ggplot(faithfuld, aes(eruptions, waiting, fill = density)) +   geom_raster() +   scale_fill_jonohey("surfing", discrete = FALSE)

title: Basic Usage
text: provide two different themes: theme_card() give nice round edge around plot panel /plot background  better understand functioning theme, examples:     theme_jonohey_wiggle() give wiggly axis.  version, provide minimal wiggly configurations powered {elementalist}. decide need grooves can implement . example:
code: p <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(factor(cyl), mpg, fill = factor(cyl))) +   geom_boxplot(width = 0.7) +   scale_fill_jonohey("suit")  # round panel and plot p + theme_card(round_plot = TRUE, radius_plot = 50) # Rounded panel only p + theme_card(radius_panel = 20) # plot not rounded, fill with gray50 p + theme_card(radius_panel = 20, plot_bg_fill = "gray50") # Rounded plot background and rounded panel # increased rounding for both p + theme_card(radius_panel = 30, round_plot = TRUE, radius_plot = 70,                plot_bg_fill = "gray50") # Transparent outer card, rounded inner panel p + theme_card(radius_panel = 30, round_plot = FALSE, plot_bg_fill = NA) p + theme_axes_wiggle() p +   theme_axes_wiggle() +    theme(panel.grid.major = elementalist::element_line_wiggle(2,                                                               color = "gray20",                                                              linewidth = 0.2))

code: @Manual{,   title = {jonohey: Jonohey Color Palettes},   author = {Matias Andina},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://matiasandina.github.io/jonohey/}, }

title: Jonohey Color Palettes
text: goal jonohey provide color palettes inspired Jono Hey’s sketches Sketchplanations.

title: Jonohey Color Palettes
text: can install development version jonohey GitHub :

title: Jonohey Color Palettes
text: examples display color palettes . utilization package, check docs 📖.  provide themes make plot bit interesting (closer nature true sketch identity!).  Typography matches exactly saved figures Rmd configured dev = "ragg_png". interactive plotting, call jonohey_use_ragg() install Fuzzy Bubbles system-wide.  Check 📖 docs!
code: library(jonohey) library(patchwork) library(ggplot2)  plot_box_mtcars <- function(palette_name) {   d <- transform(mtcars, cyl = factor(cyl))   ggplot(d, aes(cyl, mpg, fill = cyl)) +     geom_boxplot(width = 0.7) +     scale_fill_jonohey(palette_name) +     labs(title = "Boxplot: mtcars mpg by cyl")  }  plot_box_mtcars("suit") # make a round panel! plot_box_mtcars("suit") + theme_card(radius_panel = 18) # Make it more cartoonish plot_box_mtcars("suit") + theme_axes_wiggle()

title: Jonohey Color Palettes
text: Since provide custom font (“Fuzzy Bubbles”) match sketchy look, recommend using ragg graphics device saving plots ensure consistent typography. can calling jonohey_use_ragg() R session, specifying dev = "ragg_png" R Markdown document’s chunk options. Rstudio, can also set ragg default graphics device Global Options “General” section. Check Ragg’s documentation details. Positron, seems ragg used default ragg >= 1.4 (see PR). ’s require ragg >= 1.4 DESCRIPTION. tested jonohey_use_ragg() seems work, scaling worse RStudio.

title: Access a jonohey palette — jonohey_pal
text: Access jonohey palette

title: Access a jonohey palette — jonohey_pal
code: jonohey_pal(   palette,   n = NULL,   type = c("discrete", "continuous"),   reverse = FALSE )

title: Access a jonohey palette — jonohey_pal
text: palette palette name n number colors. NULL, returns full palette type "discrete" "continuous" reverse reverse order

title: Access a jonohey palette — jonohey_pal
text: character vector hex colors, function continuous scales used ggplot

title: List available palettes — jonohey_palettes
text: List available palettes

text: Save PNG ragg transparent device bg

Save a PNG with ragg and transparent device bg — jonohey_save_png
text: filename output filename plot ggplot object export transparent bg ... passed ggplot2::ggsave()

title: Preview a palette — jonohey_show
text: Preview palette

title: Preview a palette — jonohey_show
text: palette Name palette show. Available names can found using jonohey_palettes()

what: Prefer ragg in the IDE plot pane or fall back to a ragg PNG device — jonohey_use_ragg
title: Prefer ragg in the IDE plot pane or fall back to a ragg PNG device — jonohey_use_ragg
text: RStudio/Posit: switches plot pane backend ragg closes current pane device next plot uses ragg immediately. Elsewhere: sets default graphics device ragg::agg_png session.

title: Prefer ragg in the IDE plot pane or fall back to a ragg PNG device — jonohey_use_ragg

what: ggplot2 color scale for jonohey palettes — scale_color_jonohey
title: ggplot2 color scale for jonohey palettes — scale_color_jonohey
text: Works exactly like scale_fill_jonohey() applies color aesthetics.

ggplot2 color scale for jonohey palettes — scale_color_jonohey
text: palette palette name jonohey_palettes() discrete logical. TRUE use discrete scale, else continuous reverse logical. Reverse palette order ... passed ggplot2 scale constructors

title: Jonohey axes-wiggle theme — theme_axes_wiggle
text: axes wiggle (cartoony vibe) using elementalist. Geoms remain straight. grid, ticks. Rounded panel optional (args round theme).

title: Jonohey axes-wiggle theme — theme_axes_wiggle
code: theme_axes_wiggle(   base_size = 12,   base_family = "Fuzzy Bubbles",   amount = 3,   wiggle_n = 100,   linewidth = 1,   line_color = "gray20",   ... )

title: Jonohey axes-wiggle theme — theme_axes_wiggle
text: base_size base font size base_family base font family amount wiggle intensity (approx. pixels) wiggle_n number control points wiggle linewidth linewidth passed axes line_color color passed axes ... passed ggplot2 theme constructors

what: Jonohey card theme (rounded panel and optional rounded plot background) — theme_card
title: Jonohey card theme (rounded panel and optional rounded plot background) — theme_card
text: Draws rounded, card-like panel using elementalist. Border rendered clipping disabled stroke width looks even large radii.

title: Jonohey card theme (rounded panel and optional rounded plot background) — theme_card
code: theme_card(   radius_panel = 30,   panel_fill = NULL,   panel_border_colour = "gray20",   panel_border_linewidth = 0.5,   base_size = 12,   base_family = "Fuzzy Bubbles",   round_plot = FALSE,   radius_plot = 30,   plot_bg_fill = NULL,   plot_border_colour = NA,   plot_border_linewidth = 0 )

title: Jonohey card theme (rounded panel and optional rounded plot background) — theme_card
text: radius_panel Corner radius points panel panel_fill Fill color panel (defaults package bg) panel_border_colour Panel border color panel_border_linewidth Panel border linewidth base_size Base font size base_family Base font family round_plot Logical. Round outer plot background card radius_plot Corner radius points plot background plot_bg_fill Fill color plot background. Use NA transparent plot_border_colour Plot background border color plot_border_linewidth Plot background border linewidth

title: Jonohey card theme (rounded panel and optional rounded plot background) — theme_card
text: plain list ggplot components add +

title: Jonohey card theme (rounded panel and optional rounded plot background) — theme_card
text: Internally adds coord_cartesian(clip = ""). later add different coordinate system like coord_fixed() coord_polar(), replaces .
